title: ChatGraPhT: A Visual Conversation Interface for Multi-Path Reflection with Agentic LLM Support
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly used in complex knowledge work, yet linear transcript interfaces limit support for reflection. Schon's Reflective Practice distinguishes between reflection-in-action (during a task) and reflection-on-action (after a task), both benefiting from non-linear, revisitable representations of dialogue.
